results.title: Affluent, Anxious and Almost Normal: A Journey Through Merkel’s Germany

results.title: Whales So Close You Can Touch Them: A Family Adventure in Canada
results.abstract: Recalling a prepandemic trip to a watery landscape in Quebec province: “The adventure we had feels like one plucked from a world I can no longer reach, not unlike watching the water, waiting for a whale to crest.”

results.title: Wole Soyinka Is Not Going Anywhere
results.abstract: The Nobel laureate, whose new novel, “Chronicles From the Land of the Happiest People on Earth,” is his first in nearly 50 years, refuses to back down when he senses that his homeland’s freedom is under threat.
des_facet: Chronicles From the Land of the Happiest People on Earth (Book)

multimedia.caption: “Unfortunately, some of us are not very wise. We know what we ought to do, when we should retire, go and hide out somewhere, live a life of ease,” Wole Soyinka said. “But we don’t take our own advice, do we?”
multimedia.copyright: Yagazie Emezi for The New York Times

results.title: A W.H.O. panel recommends treating high-risk Covid patients with monoclonal antibodies.
results.abstract: The expensive treatment, developed by the U.S. drug maker Regeneron and the Swiss biotech company Roche, has garnered attention as backstop for those who shun vaccines.

results.title: Daily Covid deaths rise to a new high in Russia, where vaccine hesitancy remains common.
results.abstract: The government’s numbers are widely regarded with suspicion, but Russian officials appear to be issuing more urgent warnings about the virus.

results.title: To His Surprise, His Play About 2 Dead U.K. Politicians Struck a Chord
results.abstract: After decades in the political sphere, Michael McManus turned to theater. His play, “Maggie & Ted,” explores the tensions that would pave the way for Brexit.

results.title: C.D.C. Chief Overrules Agency Panel and Recommends Pfizer-BioNTech Boosters for Workers at Risk
results.abstract: In a highly unusual decision, the C.D.C. director, Rochelle Walensky, reversed a move by agency advisers and endorsed additional doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine for health care workers, teachers and other workers at risk.
results.byline: By Apoorva Mandavilli and Benjamin Mueller
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
